titleStmt.title: TO THE RIGHT HONO∣RABLE GEORGE LORD BARKLEY, of Barkely Castle.

publicationStmt.publisher: To the Reader: The English Preface in Print, c. 1475-1640 / Early English Books Online Text Creation Partnership

analytic.title: TO THE RIGHT HONO∣RABLE GEORGE LORD BARKLEY, of Barkely Castle.

monogr.title: The young admirall : As it vvas presented by her Majesties Servants, at the private house in Drury Lane. Written by James Shirly
monogr.author: Shirley, James

div.head: TO THE RIGHT HONORABLE GEORGE LORD BARKLEY, of Barkely Castle.
div.p:
THe many testimonies of your excellent nature, with so much furniture, and ornament of learning; have in the hearts of the knowing world erected monuments to your living fame, and long since prepard my particular ambition to be knowne to you, that •… , among other, whose more happy wits have g •… ind by being onely read under so noble a Patron, might by some timely application derive upon me your Lordships influence. Be pleas'd my most honourable Lord to accept this Poeme, till something of more high endeavour
may present my service, yet let me not barre it the truth of this Character, it hath beene grateful to the stage, and graciously entertain'd at Court by their Majesties, Now if your Lordship smile upon it in this addresse, and bid it welcome, it shall dwell with honour and security under your name, and the author glory to professe himselfe
